Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Listen for short periods of time
Elaboration: Watching and listening to what peers are doing, following a speaker and watching the teacher’s face for limited periods of time

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Listen for short periods of time
Elaboration: Demonstrating that they are paying attention through some paralinguistic (non-verbal) communication; for example, using body orientation, eye contact, facial expressions, nodding, smiling, laughing and gesturing

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Listen for short periods of time
Elaboration: Using some body language to respond directly to a speaker; for example, nodding and using facial expressions

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to repetitive questions and prompts
Elaboration: Recognising repetitive questions based on question stems such as ‘Who’, ‘Where’ and ‘When’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to repetitive questions and prompts
Elaboration: Understanding a short, simple spoken text when accompanied by visual support; for example, following an explanation of a simple game or modelled instructions to complete a task such as cutting out a picture and sticking it in a book

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Respond to repetitive questions and prompts
Elaboration: Giving short, simple paralinguistic (non-verbal) responses (e.g. by nodding or gesturing) and single-word utterances (e.g. ‘yes’ and ‘no’)

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in highly contextualised social and learning activities
Elaboration: Observing peers and copying actions in response to classroom activities; for example, getting their lunchbox from their bag, lining up when the music plays for the end of lunch break and putting scissors away at the end of a learning activity

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in highly contextualised social and learning activities
Elaboration: Recognising some action verbs in highly routine instructions when accompanied by teacher gestures or actions, for example in ‘Stand up.’ and ‘Sit down.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in highly contextualised social and learning activities
Elaboration: Borrowing key words from questions to compose answers; for example, Student 1: ‘Do you want to play chasey?’, Student 2: ‘Yeah, play chasey.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in highly contextualised social and learning activities
Elaboration: Responding to simple, direct questions about personal or familiar topics, for example when asked ‘Do you have a dog?’ and ‘How old are you?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Follow a short sequence of simple utterances, with extensive support
Elaboration: Recognising and following one- and/or 2-step instructions based on the actions of peers, for example when asked ‘Put the lid on the glue stick.’ and ‘Put your book away and sit on the mat.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Follow a short sequence of simple utterances, with extensive support
Elaboration: Attentively listening and completing actions in the correct order

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Follow a short sequence of simple utterances, with extensive support
Elaboration: Actively participating in tasks where everyone follows the same sequence; for example, singing an action song and completing a guided activity

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise parts of a simple spoken text
Elaboration: Recognising common speech functions such as questions, statements and commands, for example ‘What are you eating?’ and ‘Come and sit on the floor.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise parts of a simple spoken text
Elaboration: Recognising a small number of familiar spoken texts used frequently in class, such as everyday vocabulary, songs, rhymes and stories

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise parts of a simple spoken text
Elaboration: Listening to a story, then recalling and retelling its events concisely in spoken form

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use short, learnt phrases
Elaboration: Using single-word or phrasal responses to questions, for example ‘Yes.’, ‘No.’ and ‘I don’t know.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use short, learnt phrases
Elaboration: Using learnt phrases in play, for example ‘Give me.’, ‘Stop it.’, ‘I don’t like.’ and ‘Very good!’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use short, learnt phrases
Elaboration: Creating original utterances by substituting unfamiliar words in learnt patterns or formulas, for example ‘It’s home time.’ and ‘It’s go time.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Construct simple subject–verb sentences that mostly use present tense
Elaboration: Constructing short, simple statements with subject followed by verb, for example ‘He sick.’ and ‘Students go home.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Construct simple subject–verb sentences that mostly use present tense
Elaboration: Expressing negation using ‘no’ or ‘not’, and with adjectives or nouns, often with some errors, for example ‘I no like vegetable.’, ‘I not go.’, ‘Not hot today.’ or ‘Not me.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Construct simple subject–verb sentences that mostly use present tense
Elaboration: Replying to questions using simple subject–verb sentences, for example ‘I play games.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Construct simple subject–verb sentences that mostly use present tense
Elaboration: Engaging in simple interactive games such as sentence construction games (e.g. He + jumps = He jumps) and role-playing (e.g. ‘describe the role and actions’)

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Demonstrate placement of common adjectives and adverbs to describe or add emphasis
Elaboration: Combining an adjective with a noun to create simple noun groups, with varying degrees of accuracy, for example ‘big truck’ and ‘car blue’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Demonstrate placement of common adjectives and adverbs to describe or add emphasis
Elaboration: Combining multiple adjectives to describe a noun, placing them in the correct order, for example in ‘The big red ball.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Demonstrate placement of common adjectives and adverbs to describe or add emphasis
Elaboration: Using basic adverbs to vary intensity, for example in ‘very hot’ and ‘bit funny’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use a small set of frequently occurring words related to immediate communicative needs
Elaboration: Using common words related to immediate needs (such as colours, numbers, days, and family- and school-specific word sets), for example in ‘Today is Thursday.’, ‘Circle is blue.’ and ‘She my mum.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use a small set of frequently occurring words related to immediate communicative needs
Elaboration: Constructing simple sentences with high-frequency words, for example ‘I like.’, ‘He run.’ and ‘It book.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and use a small set of frequently occurring words related to immediate communicative needs
Elaboration: Using classroom vocabulary charts and other environmental print resources to identify and help remember words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Attempt intelligible pronunciation
Elaboration: Imitating and rehearsing pronunciation for familiar and commonly used words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Attempt intelligible pronunciation
Elaboration: Imitating and reproducing pronunciation in chants, songs and rhymes

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Attempt intelligible pronunciation
Elaboration: Saying the sounds when given a word that is known, for example ‘c-a-n’ for ‘can’ and ‘sh-i-p’ for ‘ship’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and copy sentence stress and intonation patterns
Elaboration: Imitating and rehearsing stress and intonation patterns used by the teacher and peers, for example in stories, songs and rhymes

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise and copy sentence stress and intonation patterns
Elaboration: Producing accurate sentence stress and intonation for a small range of familiar and commonly used phrases, including personal language, classroom language and social formulas, for example ‘It is very hot!’ and ‘What is your name?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish spoken English from home language(s)
Elaboration: Recognising some sounds and words of English when being spoken to

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish spoken English from home language(s)
Elaboration: Switching from a home language to English and vice versa when prompted

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish spoken English from home language(s)
Elaboration: Attempting to pronounce a small range of familiar words, including personal language, classroom language and some basic topic vocabulary, although often pronouncing new English words using sounds from a home language

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use simple strategies to help spoken understanding
Elaboration: Indicating non-comprehension through facial expressions or body language and/or by attracting the teacher’s attention, for example by raising their hand

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use simple strategies to help spoken understanding
Elaboration: Attempting to repeat, re-pronounce or self-correct key words when prompted by a listener

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use simple strategies to help spoken understanding
Elaboration: Checking understanding of simple, familiar instructions and routines; for example, Teacher: ‘It’s playtime.’ Student: ‘Go outside?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use simple strategies to help spoken understanding
Elaboration: Asking peers in a home language and/or English to clarify misunderstandings

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use simple strategies to help spoken understanding
Elaboration: Attempting to communicate in a mix of English and a home language

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when listening and speaking
Elaboration: Asking home language peers for help to translate personal needs and responses from a home language to English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when listening and speaking
Elaboration: Asking home language peers to explain an idea in a home language and asking for a translation in English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when listening and speaking
Elaboration: Referring to a bilingual dictionary for a translation in English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use basic spoken social formulas and gestures to interact in context
Elaboration: Listening to and observing others to understand the nature of basic social interactions

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use basic spoken social formulas and gestures to interact in context
Elaboration: Interacting by copying the actions of peers

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use basic spoken social formulas and gestures to interact in context
Elaboration: Responding to comments in simple paralinguistic (non-verbal) ways, for example by shaking or nodding their head in response to questions

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use basic spoken social formulas and gestures to interact in context
Elaboration: Copying learnt social formulas when interacting with others; for example, saying ‘please’ and ‘thank you’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Look for meaning in texts
Elaboration: Indicating to a sign and asking the teacher or a peer to read it aloud and explain the meaning

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Look for meaning in texts
Elaboration: Recognising that print and digital texts are created to share a message or idea

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Look for meaning in texts
Elaboration: Selecting from familiar texts to achieve a specific purpose; for example, pointing to the correct chart when the teacher asks, ‘Which chart tells us about time?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Look for meaning in texts
Elaboration: Recalling the key message of sections of a familiar text that is revisited in class

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar words and formulaic utterances, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Recognising some familiar, personally significant words in context, for example when seeing their own name above their bag hook or locker, or peers’ names on labels and days of the week

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar words and formulaic utterances, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Identifying some familiar vocabulary (mainly content words) in a supported context, for example during shared reading or teacher-led discussion of a classroom text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar words and formulaic utterances, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Reading some familiar words and short phrases in context, for example on everyday signs and labels, familiar names, some letters, basic numbers and some common logos

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify signs and images, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Using images to help identify the content of a text and predict individual words in texts about familiar topics

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify signs and images, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Identifying the main character in an image; for example, pointing to the main character in an illustration

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify signs and images, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Pointing to images of familiar words, for example to ‘apple’, ‘girl’ and ‘house’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify signs and images, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Matching a short description such as ‘a green fruit’ to an image

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify signs and images, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Following instructions on simple signs, for example when asked ‘Stop.’ and ‘Line up here.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Make simple predictions about a text, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Suggesting the topic of a text based on understanding content words in the title

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Make simple predictions about a text, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Using the illustrations in a shared picture story to make predictions about what the text is about or what might happen next in a story

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Make simple predictions about a text, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Using repeated language patterns and sounds to make predictions in a story such as We’re Going on a Bear Hunt

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise different types of texts
Elaboration: Navigating different types of texts; for example, turning the pages of a book, swiping to change the page when reading a digital text, clicking hyperlinks on a webpage and finding points of interest on a map

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise different types of texts
Elaboration: Understanding terms such as ‘book’, ‘author’, ‘picture’ and ‘word’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise different types of texts
Elaboration: Recognising that texts have a range of purposes such as telling a story or providing information

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar words and phrases
Elaboration: Recognising and reading personally significant words, for example when seeing their own name on charts, book labels and name tags

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar words and phrases
Elaboration: Pointing to or counting repeated words in a text, for example when asked ‘How many times can you see the word “me”?’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar words and phrases
Elaboration: Recognising common words and phrases from familiar charts, labels and books

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar words and phrases
Elaboration: Recognising labels such as ‘books’ and ‘recycling’ on frequently accessed classroom items

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise familiar words and phrases
Elaboration: Blending some basic sounds to create simple words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise some letters of the alphabet and some sounds in words
Elaboration: Recognising and naming some letters of the alphabet

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise some letters of the alphabet and some sounds in words
Elaboration: Consistently identifying common letters in different words; for example, pointing to all the ‘t’s in a sentence

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise some letters of the alphabet and some sounds in words
Elaboration: Recognising the same letters written in different handwriting styles or fonts

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise some letters of the alphabet and some sounds in words
Elaboration: Recognising letters in their own name

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise some letters of the alphabet and some sounds in words
Elaboration: Recognising some vowel–consonant (VC) and consonant–vowel–consonant (CVC) words, for example ‘it’, ‘is’, ‘sat’ and ‘bad’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise capital letters, spaces and full stops
Elaboration: Showing awareness that words are separated by spaces, for example by pointing to words or counting words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise capital letters, spaces and full stops
Elaboration: Pointing to capital letters and full stops in a text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise capital letters, spaces and full stops
Elaboration: Identifying names or proper nouns in a text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise capital letters, spaces and full stops
Elaboration: Locating letters, in both lower-case and capital form, in a short text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify English texts from home language texts
Elaboration: Holding a book with the correct orientation and locating the front and back of the book, based on the written language used in the text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify English texts from home language texts
Elaboration: Tracking with a finger from left to right when reading or listening to an English text being read aloud

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Identify English texts from home language texts
Elaboration: Identifying when a book is written in English and when a book is written in a home language

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Select and engage with a variety of texts, with teacher and peer support
Elaboration: Looking at or reading a book in their own personal time

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Select and engage with a variety of texts, with teacher and peer support
Elaboration: Exploring a new book before reading by looking at the images, the amount of print and familiar elements

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Select and engage with a variety of texts, with teacher and peer support
Elaboration: Selecting books in their home language(s), bilingual texts and texts related to familiar topics to share with family members

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Select and engage with a variety of texts, with teacher and peer support
Elaboration: Engaging with picture books selected by the teacher and some self-selected books

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when reading and viewing
Elaboration: Asking home language peers for help translating personal needs and responses from a home language to English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when reading and viewing
Elaboration: Referring to home language texts to support translating unfamiliar words in English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when reading and viewing
Elaboration: Asking home language peers to explain an idea in a home language and asking for a translation in English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Observe and begin to participate in teacher-led shared reading activities
Elaboration: Listening to the teacher or a peer read texts aloud

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Observe and begin to participate in teacher-led shared reading activities
Elaboration: Chorusing reading with the teacher and peers

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Observe and begin to participate in teacher-led shared reading activities
Elaboration: Identifying and stating key repetitive phrases such as ‘swish, swish’, ‘beep, beep’ and ‘zoom, zoom’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Observe and begin to participate in teacher-led shared reading activities
Elaboration: Imitating the pronunciation of the teacher and peers in shared reading activities

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Observe and begin to participate in teacher-led shared reading activities
Elaboration: Observing and following activities to accompany texts; for example, performing actions for a song by copying the teacher or following instructions for a simple science activity

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Copy familiar symbols, words, phrases and short, simple sentences, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Tracing or copying letters, words and sentences written by the teacher

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Copy familiar symbols, words, phrases and short, simple sentences, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Copying and completing short, formulaic sentences to describe familiar objects, for example ‘This is a …’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Copy familiar symbols, words, phrases and short, simple sentences, with extensive teacher support
Elaboration: Completing model sentences giving personal information, for example ‘My name is …’ and ‘I have … people in my family.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Illustrate a simple concept and label, with contextual support
Elaboration: Writing the names of items depicted in images or in a caption

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Illustrate a simple concept and label, with contextual support
Elaboration: Copying and completing short, formulaic sentences to describe images, for example ‘This is a …’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Illustrate a simple concept and label, with contextual support
Elaboration: Matching images with correct words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Copy a very simple text structure
Elaboration: Copying the structure of classroom texts; for example, using the same sentence stems or writing the details in the same order

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Copy simple modelled sentences
Elaboration: Copying a small range of sentences from a model text, for example ‘I like …’, ‘I went to …’ and ‘Today is …’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use some basic noun–verb combinations
Elaboration: Writing simple verbs as single words or part of short phrases, for example in ‘He runs.’, ‘She ate.’ and ‘Dog woofed.’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use some basic adjective–noun combinations
Elaboration: Writing simple adjectives as single words or part of short phrases, for example in ‘tall tree’, ‘yellow sun’ and ‘cold water’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write some high-frequency words related to personal experiences and school context
Elaboration: Writing their own name

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write some high-frequency words related to personal experiences and school context
Elaboration: Writing familiar high-frequency words, for example ‘it’, ‘my’ and ‘we’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Write some high-frequency words related to personal experiences and school context
Elaboration: Labelling simple images, for example ‘tree’, ‘sun’ and ‘sky’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Apply developing phonics knowledge to spell some vowel–consonant (VC) and some consonant–vowel–consonant (CVC) words
Elaboration: Using initial letters (e.g. ‘b’ for ‘book’) or beginning and ending sounds (e.g. ‘bk’ for ‘book’) to spell words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Apply developing phonics knowledge to spell some vowel–consonant (VC) and some consonant–vowel–consonant (CVC) words
Elaboration: Spelling some high-frequency words accurately from memory, including their own name and short words used regularly

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Apply developing phonics knowledge to spell some vowel–consonant (VC) and some consonant–vowel–consonant (CVC) words
Elaboration: Identifying some consonant–vowel–consonant (CVC) words, representing sounds with the appropriate letters, for example ‘s-a-t’ and ‘p-o-t’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Apply developing phonics knowledge to spell some vowel–consonant (VC) and some consonant–vowel–consonant (CVC) words
Elaboration: Making plausible spelling choices using phoneme–grapheme correspondences and morphemic knowledge, for example ‘blk’ for ‘black’ and ‘rd’ for ‘read’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use capital letters and full stops
Elaboration: Using basic punctuation, for example full stops at the end of sentences

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use capital letters and full stops
Elaboration: Using capital letters to begin sentences and names

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Use capital letters and full stops
Elaboration: Participating in shared editing by circling the capital letters at the beginning of sentences or full stops at the end of sentences

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish between writing and drawing
Elaboration: Accurately indicating an example of writing or drawing when asked

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish between writing and drawing
Elaboration: Following instructions to write or draw; for example, attempting to write when instructed to write their name, or to draw when instructed to draw a face

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish between writing and drawing
Elaboration: Understanding some of the basic terms used in writing, such as ‘word’, ‘letter’, ‘sentence’, ‘space’ and ‘full stop’

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish between writing and drawing
Elaboration: Using implements appropriate for the task when writing or drawing; for example, using pens, pencils, crayons, digital tools and rulers

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish between writing and drawing
Elaboration: Writing English from left to right and top to bottom

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Distinguish between writing and drawing
Elaboration: Leaving a space between clusters of letters that represent words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the importance of accurate reproduction of letters and words
Elaboration: Copying words carefully from a resource such as a book or poster or asking in English for a word to be written so it can be copied

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the importance of accurate reproduction of letters and words
Elaboration: Copying a short corrected version of their own text, for example with corrected spelling or capital letters

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the importance of accurate reproduction of letters and words
Elaboration: Asking in English and/or a home language how to copy a word

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the importance of accurate reproduction of letters and words
Elaboration: Copying upper-case and lower-case letters and numbers, using consistent and accurate letter formation

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the importance of accurate reproduction of letters and words
Elaboration: Accurately typing letters, numbers, symbols and words when copying from a print text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Recognise the importance of accurate reproduction of letters and words
Elaboration: Typing familiar words such as their own name, without copying

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when writing
Elaboration: Listening to the teacher or a peer read texts aloud

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when writing
Elaboration: Asking home language peers to explain an idea in a home language and asking for a translation in English

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when writing
Elaboration: Explaining the meaning of a home language word used in their own writing when asked; for example, pointing, or drawing an image to aid communication

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when writing
Elaboration: Referring to picture dictionaries or bilingual dictionaries in the classroom to check meaning

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Draw on home language resources to enhance learning when writing
Elaboration: Making simple multilingual mind maps or vocabulary charts of key words

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared writing experiences
Elaboration: Demonstrating active listening to the contributions of others

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared writing experiences
Elaboration: Suggesting familiar settings, characters or events for shared writing experiences

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared writing experiences
Elaboration: Retelling events or describing characters from a story created during a shared writing experience

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared writing experiences
Elaboration: Contributing their own ideas during the creation of a shared story; for example, describing the character or setting, or ordering steps in a simple instructional text

Subject: English as an Additional Language
ContentDescription: Participate in shared writing experiences
Elaboration: Copying a short text jointly constructed by the class
